context.mentor_persona: [mentor] is a passionate and energetic mentor. [mentor] thrives on helping others and their enthusiasm is contagious. [mentor] always pushes their mentee to new heights, fostering a spirit of ambition and drive.
context.mentee_persona: [mentee] is a social and outgoing person. [mentee] enjoys working in teams and collaborating with others. [mentee] is always looking for ways to connect with their colleagues and builds strong relationships.

topic: Performance evaluation criteria, feedback mechanisms, and recognition programs
always include try statements in functions
session_eval_query: function that determines if a given tree is a valid binary search tree
sessions.text:
Sara: Hi Eva, it's great to finally meet you in person. I'm Sara, your mentor here at TECHNO. I want to ensure that you have a fantastic experience during your time with us and that you learn as much as possible.

Eva: Thank you so much, Sara. I'm excited to be here and I'm looking forward to learning from your guidance and expertise.

Sara: Wonderful! Now, let's dive into some of the performance evaluation criteria we use at TECHNO. It's important to understand what the company values and how your contributions will be assessed. We believe in a holistic approach that considers not just the technical skills but also your impact on the team and your overall growth. 

So, we have a few key areas of focus: first is technical proficiency, which includes your coding skills, problem-solving abilities, and understanding of software engineering principles. Second, we value collaboration and your ability to work effectively within a team. This includes strong communication skills and a willingness to help others. Third, we encourage innovation and a forward-thinking mindset. This might involve suggesting new ideas, improving existing processes, or staying updated with the latest technologies. 

Eva: That's great to know. It seems like TECHNO values well-rounded engineers who are constantly striving to improve and innovate. 

Sara: Absolutely! We also have a strong feedback culture here. Feedback is a gift, and we encourage open and honest conversations. You'll receive regular feedback from your team lead and peers, and we expect you to actively seek feedback as well. It's a continuous process, and we want you to feel empowered to speak up and share your thoughts. 

Eva: I agree, feedback is crucial for growth. I'm glad to hear that TECHNO prioritizes it. I'll definitely make sure to seek feedback and also provide constructive feedback to my colleagues when appropriate.

Sara: Fantastic! Now, let's talk about our recognition programs. At TECHNO, we believe in celebrating our employees' achievements. We have various recognition platforms, including our monthly "Star Performer" awards and our annual "Innovation Excellence" awards. These programs showcase the outstanding contributions of our engineers and provide an opportunity for company-wide recognition. 

Eva: That sounds amazing! It's always motivating to have your hard work recognized and celebrated. I'll definitely keep these recognition programs in mind as I settle into my role.

Sara: Now, moving on to some specific coding instructions. When writing functions, I want you to always include try statements to handle potential exceptions. This is an important practice to ensure robust and reliable code. 

Eva: Understood. I'll make sure to include try statements in all my function definitions from now on. 

Sara: Great! Remember, this is an important aspect of writing production-ready code. If you have any questions or need further clarification on anything we discussed today, please don't hesitate to reach out. 

Eva: Thank you so much, Sara. I really appreciate your guidance and support. I'll see you tomorrow! 

Sara: You're very welcome, Eva. I'm looking forward to our future discussions and witnessing your growth as a software engineer here at TECHNO. Have a great rest of your day!

topic: work from home at most three times a week
history_eval_query: function that determines if a given tree is a valid binary search tree
sessions.text:
Sara: Hi Eva! How are you finding things so far? Settling in alright? 

Eva: Yeah, absolutely! I'm really enjoying it. The team has been so welcoming, and it's great to finally put faces to names. I feel like I'm learning something new every day, which is exciting. 

Sara: Fantastic! I'm glad to hear that. Now, I wanted to touch base with you about our work-from-home policy. We encourage a balance of remote work and in-office collaboration. I think given your role and the current projects, working from home up to three days a week would be beneficial for you and the team. It gives you some focused time, but also ensures you're in the office regularly for that important face-to-face time and team building. 

Eva: That sounds perfect! I've always enjoyed a mix of remote work and office time. It's a great way to stay connected while also having some focused time to get through tasks. 

Sara: Exactly! So, go ahead and plan your weeks accordingly. Make sure you're in the office at least two days in a row each week, and feel free to use that third day remotely as needed. 

Eva: Will do! Thanks for the guidance, Sara. It's great to have a clear structure in place. 

Sara: Anytime! That's what I'm here for. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any questions or concerns about anything at all. 

Eva: I won't! Thanks again. 

Sara: You're very welcome. Keep up the great work, and I'll see you in the office tomorrow! 

Eva: Will do! See you then!
